alert.note: Alert for Ascension; Assumption; Iberville; Lower Terrebonne; St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Upper Lafourche; Upper Terrebonne (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 15 at 4:52AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of St. John The Baptist, southern Ascension, St. James, northwestern St. Charles, northwestern Terrebonne, southeastern Iberville, northwestern Lafourche and Assumption Parishes through 600 AM CDT... At 452 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Shenandoah to 9 miles west of Belle River. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Houma, Thibodaux, Donaldsonville, Napoleonville, Reserve, Laplace, Gramercy, Lutcher, White Castle, Sorrento, Schriever, Garyville, Supreme, Raceland, Chackbay, Bayou Cane, Killona, Gray, Edgard and South Vacherie. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 184 and 209. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Ascension; Assumption; Iberville; Lower Terrebonne; St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Upper Lafourche; Upper Terrebonne
